caption.title: Proposed functions of microRNAs during spinal motor neuron (sMN) development

tr.td: miR-9 promotes the switch from early-born to late-born motor neuron populations as well as MMC/LMC subtypes
Chicken
transient decoy of miR-9 and overexpression of miR-9 in ovo
(Luxenhofer et al., 2014; Otaegi et al., 2011)
1. miR-17–3p carves p2/pMN boundary at progenitor stage 2. miR-17 ~ 92 governs LMC-MN survival during development and degeneration in ALS
Mouse Mouse/human induced pluripotent stem cells
CAGGS:CreER; Dicer floxed and miR-17 ~ 92-/- embryos Olig2:Cre; miR-17 ~ 92 floxed embryos and miR-17 ~ 92 overexpression in human ALS-iPSC derived MNs
(Chen et al., 2011) (Tung et al., 2015; Tung et al., 2019)
miR-27 filters Hox temporal transcription noise to confer boundary formation in the spinal cord
Mouse and chicken
Sox1:Cre; Dicer floxed, transient decoy of miR-27 in ovo, and mir-23 ~ 27 ~ 24-/- embryos
(Li et al., 2017)
miR-196 confines the rostrocaudal axis in the neural tube
Chicken
Transient decoy of miR-196 in ovo
(Asli and Kessel, 2010)
miR-218 defines a neuronal gene network that is selectively tuned down in MNs to prevent neuromuscular failure and neurodegeneration.
Progenitor genes (Sox21, Tead1, etc.) Neighboring genes (Slc6a1, Bcl11a, Foxp2, etc.)
Mouse and chicken
Transient decoy of miR-218 in ovo and miR-218-/- embryos
(Amin et al., 2015; Thiebes et al., 2015)
